title: The Meaning of the 🍫 (Chocolate Bar) Emoji

steps.title: The 🍫 emoji primarily represents chocolate.
steps.content: The 🍫 emoji primarily represents chocolate. The emoji depicts a partially unwrapped chocolate candy bar, after all—so, unsurprisingly, its main meaning is “chocolate.” You can use the 🍫 emoji to tell people you’re enjoying some chocolate, express your desire to eat chocolate, or just say how much you love chocolate in general! [1] X Research source “Someone remind me why I should have dinner when I can just have chocolate 🍫” “Omg this 🍫 is so good—it has almonds in it!”

steps.title: The 🍫 emoji can also refer to National (or World) Chocolate Day.
steps.content: The 🍫 emoji can also refer to National (or World) Chocolate Day. World Chocolate Day is a day dedicated to chocolate and is recognized globally on July 7th. Then, the United States has its own National Chocolate Day on October 28th—and other countries worldwide have separate chocolate days, too. On one of these days, you might use the 🍫 emoji to celebrate! [2] X Research source “In honor of #WorldChocolateDay I’m hereby eating nothing but 🍫” “It’s National Chocolate Day?! Why don’t we do more to celebrate this?? 🍫”

steps.title: The 🍫 emoji represents a love of candy, sweets, and sugary snacks.
steps.content: The 🍫 emoji represents a love of candy, sweets, and sugary snacks. Because chocolate is such a familiar (and much-loved) ingredient in candy and dessert foods, you can use the 🍫 emoji anytime you’re talking about sweets. You could use it to say you want dessert or discuss indulging in a fantastic dessert, for example. [3] X Research source “I have such a sweet tooth it’s crazy 🍫🍬🍭🍩” “I’m really craving dessert today. Can we grab some after dinner? 🍫”

steps.title: The 🍫 emoji can also be a symbol of affection or love.
steps.content: The 🍫 emoji can also be a symbol of affection or love. Because it can be a synonym for sweet things, you might see it used to send love over text and tell someone how sweet they are. Plus, many people give chocolate as a gift, especially on Valentine’s Day. For example: [4] X Research source “You’re the sweetest! 🍫 Thank you for being such a great partner.” “I love listening to the sweet sound of your voice! 🍫”

steps.title: Respond based on whether you like or dislike chocolate.
steps.content: Respond based on whether you like or dislike chocolate. If someone mentions eating chocolate (or asks if you want any) and uses the 🍫 emoji, feel free to respond in any way that works for you. You might ask what type of chocolate they’re eating and ask for some if you love chocolate, or say, “No thanks” if it’s not your favorite treat. Them : “My favorite food is chocolate, hands down! 🍫” You : “Good pick, lol. Chocolate’s not my FAVE food, but it’s pretty good, I’ll give you that!”

steps.title: Make your own plans to celebrate National Chocolate Day.
steps.content: Make your own plans to celebrate National Chocolate Day. If you see people posting about #NationalChocolateDay (or #WorldChocolateDay), you could always tell them you plan to eat a chocolate bar in honor of the occasion. Just pick your favorite kind of chocolate and enjoy! Them : “Did you know it’s National Chocolate Day? I’m going to go buy some chocolate! 🍫” You : “Omg no! But I do now…so I think I’ll grab some chocolate to celebrate with, too!”

steps.title: Mention candy or sweets you enjoy if someone brings up the topic.
steps.content: Mention candy or sweets you enjoy if someone brings up the topic. When the 🍫 emoji is used to talk about sweet treats in general, chime in with anything you enjoy, too—whether it’s chocolate or something else. After all, there are plenty of desserts out there! Them : “I’m really feeling my sweet tooth today. Brb need to find a good snack!! 🍫” You : “Ooh, a sweet snack sounds good. I’ve been craving a donut lately! 🍩”

steps.title: Express appreciation for an affectionate text (and reciprocate it).
steps.content: Express appreciation for an affectionate text (and reciprocate it). When someone uses the 🍫 emoji to send you love and affection, let them know you appreciate the gesture! And, of course, send them love in return, even if you use some other emoji to do it. Them : “I absolutely adore you, you sweet, lovely person! 🍫” You : “Aw! I love you too! 💝”

steps.title: Pair the 🍫 emoji with others to depict different sweets and candies.
steps.content: Pair the 🍫 emoji with others to depict different sweets and candies. If you want to reference a dessert food or sweet snack you love, it’s easy to do. There are plenty of other food and drink emojis that, when used with the 🍫 emoji, can represent a specific, chocolate-flavored treat. For example: [5] X Research source 🍫☕ (Hot chocolate) 🎂🍫 (Chocolate cake) 🍫🥛 (Chocolate milk) 🐄 🍫 (Milk chocolate) 🍫🍨 (Chocolate ice cream) 🧁🍫 (Chocolate cupcake) 🎃🍬🍭🍫 (Halloween candy)

steps.title: Several other emojis represent candy and dessert foods.
steps.content: Several other emojis represent candy and dessert foods. Many of the emojis most associated with the 🍫 are other dessert emojis or foods commonly paired with chocolate (like strawberries or peanut butter). Sometimes, if a person is talking about candy in general, a 🍫 and another candy emoji might be used interchangeably. Related emojis include: 🍬 (Candy) 🍭 (Lollipop) 🍓 (Strawberry) 🍩 (Donut) 🥜 (Peanuts) 🎂 (Cake) 💝 (Gift Heart) 🍪 (Chocolate Chip Cookie)
